All right, well, Ill tell you. I do two things. Okay. I have a background in digital marketing. Okay. The way things have turned out the past few years, Ive been mostly a waiter. And the thing is, one thing I have fully seen is that the best way to market restaurants online now is not via a corporate presence on Instagram or TikTok or whatnot. Yes, thats necessary, but its more on a local level because people respond to stuff on a lot, especially once the pandemic hit. People seem to be more concerned about local concept of local. Im looking to do three things. The restaurant I work for is called Seasons 52. It is just basically American in that grill. They call it a fresh grill and wine bar. Theres about 40 some odd locations throughout the country, 45 or 46 or something like that. Okay. The good thing, first of all, a couple of years ago, before the pandemic hit, they gave local management the green light to do their own social media, but they didnt give any guidance. So Ive written a 60 page ebook on how to do local marketing. I also want to then I guess you could say coach or act as a consultant to the general managers around the country, how to do things on its no longer called Google My Business, but its the Google business suite, so they can do so because people search now for local information. Blah, blah. Restaurant. The third thing I want to do is contact corporate and run an ad campaign. The slogan. So the tagline for Seasons for you, even though it hasnt been used for a couple of years, is Whats Good Now? Because its a seasonal type restaurant down the road. Fingers crossed. Id like to get that as a client, they often wont listen to someone thats aware. But this is Season 52 as part of the Darden, which is the largest restaurant group company in the country. And what Id like to end up doing is expanding beyond what Im doing, what I would be doing for Seasons 52, and also go to other restaurants or restaurant chains. Okay? What Im saying is this. The corporate people might have an Instagram account, and they might have 50,000 followers. Theyll post something, theyll get 300 or 400 likes, so to speak. Youll have a local influencer who has 15,000, will come into the restaurant and make a video or whatnot, and shell get 700 responses more than the corporate account. So, again, my take is you need to have your local GMs understand the power of local marketing, okay? And they need to be trained. Okay?
